intro: Oenanthe mutellina, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, hollow stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a distinct, slightly bitter taste. Oenanthe mutellina is often found in wet or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
